intro: Thesium elatius, commonly known as the tall thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and fynbos areas. Thesium elatius produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by wind, contributing to its distribution across its native range. It is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, making it a distinctive feature in its natural environment.
